April 2022 County of Marin EMS ALS PR 13
CONTINUOUS POSITIVE AIRWAY
PRESSURE (CPAP) PROCEDURE
Indications
• Patients >8 years of age in severe respiratory distress and signs of CHF, COPD, and asthma
• Near drowning
Equipment
Pre-procedure
• CPAP equipment
• ALS RMC
• In-line nebulizer
• Place patient in a seated position
with legs dependent
• Follow manufacturer directions for
CPAP device set up
• Explain device to patient
Critical Information
Procedure
• Contraindications:
• Apply device to patient; set flow rate in excess
• Absolute:
of the patients inspiratory flow rate
• Age <8 years
• If albuterol and/or ipratropium appropriate, may
• Respiratory or cardiac arrest
administer with CPAP in-line nebulizer
• Agonal respirations
• Reassess VS q5 min after CPAP applied,
• Severely depressed LOC
continuous SpO2 monitoring
• S/Sx of pneumothorax
• Increase oxygen percentage if patient does not
• Inability to maintain airway
demonstrate improvement after 5 minutes of
latency
application; repeat PRN to obtain improvement
• Major trauma (especially
• Remove the CPAP device and assist
head trauma with signs of
ventilations with BVM and/or intubation if
ICP or significant chest
patient condition worsens
trauma)
• Facial anomalies or trauma
• Vomiting
• Relative contraindications
• Systolic BP <100
• History of pulmonary
fibrosis or history of
barotrauma
• Decreased LOC
SPECIAL CONSIDERATIONS
• Claustrophobia or inability
• Consider using sedation to alleviate possible to tolerate mask (after 1-2
anxiety associated with the CPAP device min trial)
